data_maturity_score.evidence: Heavy reliance on legacy on-premise tools (SQL Server, Oracle, SSIS, SSRS) with no mention of modern data stack (dbt, Airflow, Snowflake), CI/CD, or data quality testing tools. Some structured practices exist but lack modern governance or automation.

data_maturity_level.evidence: Matches score of 2 - basic pipelines with SSIS, some automation via TFS, but inconsistent modern practices and no cloud or data governance tools mentioned.

maturity_signals.evidence: Mentions compliance with federal/state laws and data protection policies, indicating some governance. No modern stack, CI/CD, or quality testing tools mentioned.

scope_creep_score.evidence: Role combines data engineering (ETL, data warehousing) with BI reporting (SSRS, OBIEE, Tableau) and some DBA tasks (backups, performance tuning), indicating moderate scope creep.

overtime_risk_score.evidence: Hybrid work model and no explicit overtime/PTO mentions suggest moderate risk. Financial industry context may imply higher pressure, but no 'fast-paced' or 'immediate start' language.

role_clarity.evidence: Well-defined responsibilities centered on BI data engineering, ETL, and reporting with specific tools mentioned. No vague or overly broad language.

overall_red_flag_score.evidence: Moderate risk due to scope creep (BI + DE + DBA) and legacy tech stack, but balanced by clear role definition and no extreme urgency signals.

reporting_structure_clarity.evidence: Mentions working with analysts, product managers, and business users but does not specify reporting manager or team structure.

manager_level_inferred.evidence: No manager title or level mentioned in job posting or Pass 1/2 extraction.

team_growth_velocity.evidence: No mention of team expansion or hiring velocity; role appears to be a standard hire within existing structure.

team_composition.evidence: No explicit team size or composition details provided in job posting.

reporting_structure.evidence: No reporting line specified in job description.

cross_functional_embedded.evidence: Mentions working with business users and analysts but no indication of embedded cross-functional product teams; suggests centralized data/BI team.

work_life_balance_score.evidence: Hybrid work model is positive, but no PTO, unlimited time off, or work-life balance signals mentioned. Financial industry context may imply moderate pressure.

growth_opportunities_score.evidence: Mentions 'professional growth' and training/conferences, but no clear career paths, mentorship, or promotion opportunities outlined.

tech_culture_score.evidence: Legacy tech stack (SQL Server, Oracle, SSIS) with no modern practices (CI/CD, testing, code reviews) mentioned. Limited innovation signals.

tech_culture_signals.evidence: No mention of open source, tech blogs, conference speaking, hackathons, or innovation time.

dev_practices_mentioned.evidence: No explicit mention of code review, pair programming, TDD, CI/CD, monitoring, incident response, postmortems, design docs, or RFC process.

innovation_signals.evidence: Focus on maintaining and optimizing existing systems (SSIS, SQL Server) with no mention of new tech exploration or R&D.

tech_debt_awareness.evidence: No mention of tech debt, refactoring, or modernization efforts in job description.

ai_integration_level.evidence: No mention of ML, AI, or GenAI in job description or Pass 1 extraction.

ml_tools_expected.evidence: No ML/AI tools mentioned or inferred from job description.

hiring_urgency.evidence: No 'ASAP', 'immediate start', or 'urgent' language; standard hiring timeline implied.

competition_level.evidence: Hybrid role in NYC (high competition area) with 6+ years experience requirement; salary range is competitive for region but not exceptional.

company_stage_inferred.evidence: UNFCU is a global not-for-profit financial institution serving UN community, suggesting stable, established organization rather than startup.

hiring_velocity.evidence: No indication of aggressive hiring or expansion; appears to be a standard replacement or backfill role.

team_size_signals.evidence: No team size or engineering headcount mentioned in job posting.

funding_stage_signals.evidence: No funding stage or financial health signals mentioned in job description.

role_creation_type.evidence: No indication whether this is a new headcount, backfill, or team expansion.

strength_details: Transparent salary range ($105k-$140k) with geographic adjustment
Clear responsibilities focused on BI data engineering and ETL
Opportunities for training and conference attendance
Stable, established financial institution with purposeful culture
concern_details: Heavy reliance on legacy tools (SQL Server, SSIS, Oracle) with no modern stack
Role combines DE, BI, and DBA responsibilities creating scope creep risk
No visa sponsorship mentioned; US work authorization required
Limited career growth signals and no clear promotion paths
best_fit_details: Senior DEs with 6+ years seeking stable enterprise environment
BI-focused engineers experienced with SSIS, SSRS, and dimensional modeling
Candidates with financial industry experience or compliance background
Those comfortable with hybrid work and legacy tech stack
probe_details: Ask about actual tech stack evolution plans and modernization roadmap
Understand career progression opportunities and promotion criteria
Clarify expected work hours and on-call requirements
Confirm visa sponsorship eligibility for non-US citizens
leverage_details: 6+ years with SQL Server and SSIS is a strong match for requirements
Financial industry experience is a valuable differentiator
summary.overall_assessment: Stable opportunity for senior BI data engineers seeking enterprise environment with clear responsibilities and transparent compensation. Main trade-offs are legacy technology stack, combined BI/DE/DBA scope, and limited growth signals. Best suited for candidates prioritizing stability over innovation.
